item.title: Water | Miriam Grupo carboys with high levels of bacteria
item.description:
It is the third case, since the beginning of the year, of waters distributed in Macau without complying with quality standards. The carboys were provided to public services, such as health services. In reaction to the case, Miriam Group accuses “some customers” of purposely contaminating the carboys used
The Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) has announced that several water carboys supplied to public services of the brand Sun spoiled in quality tests, presenting high levels of coliform bacteria and pseudomonas aeruginosa bacteria. Coliform are a type of bacteria, such as E.Coli, which inhabit the gut of mammals, while pseudomonas aeruginosa bacteria can be found in waters and soils and can lead to severe infections in the lungs, skin or urinary tract. The problem with water Sun, from Miriam Group Limited, was identified in lots produced on May 7 and 21 this year, and communicated on Friday. However, the information provided by AMI and SS did not reveal the time when the problems were detected by the entities. Since the beginning of the year, this has been the third brand of Macao Águas de Macau to have quality and safety problems. The first case took place on 9 March with the Iceblue brand, from the Oi Kou Pou factory. More recently, also in May, authorities have detected problems with water from the Ieong IAT Tat brand. Water Sun will have been provided to local public services, including health services (SS). However, it was denied that the contaminated water had entered the retail, hospitals or schools. "The two lots of distilled water did not enter the retail market, being mainly supplied to government services and commercial societies. The lots were not supplied to schools or hospitals," was reported by SS. After disclosure of the information, the SS announced the cancellation of the water supply of that brand: “After verification, the lots concerned were not provided to health services. However, for safety reasons, health services stopped using the potable waters of that brand, and began to use the bottled waters of another qualified brand, in order to ensure the supply of drinking water”, was justified. The statement does not identify whether there is a new water supplier or if the watermark of Miriam Grupo Limitada has been changed. Attack of “some customers” Upon detection of this case, AMI reported that it requested the group to “apply prevention measures, namely the collection of the distilled water lots, as well as implementing the cleaning and disinfection of the water production line”. Miriam Grupo Limitada also responded to the case by indicating that since June 1, which had issued a warning to warn of the collection of contaminated lots and that since May 30 the water production has been suspended for cleaning and applying the necessary rectifications. The same information indicated that compared to the plot of 7 May were collected 196 of the 367 carboys of water produced and compared to the lot of 21 May were collected 121 of the 432 carboys of distributed water. "Under the witness and organization of the AMI, the plots of abnormal water carboys were eliminated. Between May 30 and June 1, an independent cleaning company also cleaned the factory and production equipment. About 9,000 water carboys in May were eliminated," was released by the group. In the statement, the group also complained of media coverage, and denied that the lot of May 7 had presented positive results of coliform bacteria contamination, not denied contamination with pseudomonas aeruginosa bacteria. Miriam Grupo Limitada also accused some customers of contaminating the used carboys, which are later returned, to harm the company.

item.title: Visitors | Second best start up to May
item.description:
Between January and May, 16.3 million visitors were received, the second best record of visitors. However, the number is still below what happened before the pandemic and the policy of isolation
Macau received 16.3 million visitors in the first five months of this year, the second highest amount ever for a year start, was announced on Friday. According to official data, the number of tourists who passed by Macau was only surpassed between January and May 2019 -before the COVID -19 pandemic -during a period when nearly 17.2 million visitors. However, according to the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC), almost 59 percent of visitors arrived on organized excursions and spent less than one day in the city. In 2024, the central government released a series of measures to support Macau, such as the increase in the tax exemption limit of goods for personal use acquired by visitors from China. At the same time, the Chinese authorities widened 10 other cities in China the list of places with “individual visas” to visit Hong Kong and Macau. Also, since January 1 that residents of the neighboring city of Zhuhai can visit Macau once a week and stay up to seven days. As a result, the overwhelming majority (90.7 percent) of tourists who arrived in Macao in the first two months of the year came from interior or Hong Kong, while only 1.14 million were international visitors. On January 17, Macao's director of tourism services, Maria Helena de Senna Fernandes, said he hoped Macau could receive between 38 and 39 million visitors this year. In August, the leader pointed to more than three million international visitors in 2025. More without visas The territory authorities announced on Monday that Saudi Arabia national citizens, Qatar, Kuwait, Barizer and Oman are dismissed from a visa to enter Macao from July 16. The measure comes at a time when the Macao government wants to attract more international visitors and after the territory's authorities and tour operators visited in February Saudi Arabia and Dubai to promote cooperation. Despite the increase in the number of tourists, the average consumption of each visitor, excluding in the casinos, fell 13.2 percent in the first quarter of the year, compared to the same period of 2024. In early May, the direction of statistics and census services in the region pointed to the “change of visitors' consumption pattern” as one of the main reasons for the fall of 1.3 percent of Macau's economy between January and March. It was the first time that the territory's gross domestic product has shrunk in homologous terms since the end of 2022, when the region began to raise restrictions due to Covid-19 pandemic.

This time, if Ka Lon applies to Al through the indirect suffrage. Kevin Ho and Si Ka Lon are also deputies by Macau to the National People's Assembly. Regarding 2021, the union of Macau business interests maintains in the lists José Chui Sai Peng, businessman, and IP Sio Kai, vice president of the Banco da China Macao branch. These two candidates, as well as Kevin Ho and Si Ka Lon, have the election confirmed, given that in the industrial, commercial and financial sectors there is only one list for four places. item.title: PATANE MARKET | CE hears complaints from traders
item.description:
The chief executive visited several neighborhoods of Macau, including Fai Chi Kei, Ilha Verde and the Canidroma Zone. In the Patane market, Sam Hou Fai heard complaints of bad business and promised to find solutions together with society. In addition, it revealed that the possibility of connecting Qingmao is being studied to Fai Chi Kei through the light meter
The chief executive made a journey through the Macau Peninsula on Saturday, visiting several neighborhoods accompanied by secretaries of his executive. Sam Hou Fai went to the Patane market, the Ilha Verde neighborhood and the Fai Chi Kei neighborhood, “to find out about the business exploration environment, as well as visited the former Yat Yuen canhydrome” to learn about the construction work of the Sports Park. In the Patane Municipal Market, the government leader hear traders who complained about the lack of customers and weak sales. “We are living very difficult times. We can only earn 200 or 300 patacas a day, although market income is low, we can't cover expenses. If you can not solve [the problem], how can we solve?” Asked a trader from a fresh product sales board. Sam Hou Fai pointed to cooperation. “Let's work together to solve the problem,” replied the ruler. The saleswoman returned to the cargo and argued that online consumer habits razed the traditional trade. "Now residents do not shop in stores. After the pandemic, they only do online shopping," warned residents. "We can't close the internet, this is impossible," he replied between laughs Sam Hou Fai, commenting that "things have changed a lot." “Let's work together to try to solve the problems,” insisted the chief executive. The banking merchant next to the answer to how the businesses went to the same scenario. "The business is still difficult, it is true. The lives of residents are becoming increasingly difficult. We hope that with their leadership, the market environment can be optimized," he said. Sam Hou Fai replied that this was also his desire. Reinforcement of supports The chief executive also visited the Patane Food Center, where he spoke to residents and tourists. Sam Hou Fai encouraged traders to "constantly implement news to explore characteristics that attract more visitors." After passing through Patane, the entourage led by the chief executive went to Ilha Verde, Fai Chi Kei and surroundings, accompanied by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP. Some traders have asked Sam Hou Fai a new round of consumption prize to improve business. The Chief Executive also took the opportunity to visit the “Sanrio Character Dream Garden”, and the FEELING HOUSE OF THE PARTY OF THE ROUND OF EDUCATION AND Youth Development Services, where it interacted with students. Regarding the “Dream Garden”, Tai Kin IP said that in about 80 days, the initiative “managed to divert more than 240,000 visitors to the social neighborhood”. Finally, Sam Hou Fai visited the land of the former Yat Yuen Caniderom where the construction of a sports park is planned and was known the situation of the work, listening to a presentation of the secretary for transport and public works, Raymond Tam. The chief executive said that the “public contest of works for the first zone is scheduled to soon”. Regarding the traffic of the adjacent zones, Sam Hou Fai revealed that the works for the eastern line of the Light Metro that connects the northern part of the city to the Taipa result at a good pace. The ruler revealed that his executive "is studying the possibility of extending the line of the slight meter from the Qingmao border post to the Fai Chi Kei neighborhood, as well as the future sports park."

item.title: History | The MA-chan escape to the colonial and macau
item.description:
The MA-chan family is from Mozambique with Chinese roots, sought its new path in the then colonial Portugal and since 1976 that set roots in Macao. José Manuel Machon, resident in the territory since he was 13, told Lusa the very peculiar trajectory of his family, which reflects many of the family directions taken in the years of war and the end of the Portuguese colonial empire
The MA-chan, the Mozambican family with roots in China, fled twice to communism and twice resumed in colonial Portugal. In 1976, they landed in Macao, where Mozambique's memory had erased with the departure of the Landins, African troops that parked in the territory for decades since 1912. According to a report by Luís Andrade de Sá published in Macau magazine in 1992, and quoted by the blog "Chronicles Macanese", the Landins were in Macao "for about five decades", and "the Chinese never used to their conviviality, suspiciously who had the huge blacks who played a horrible drumsticks while returning the ostensiva. ferocity ”. The term Landim became a reference “to identify all indigenous battalions that passed by Macau”, is described in the same report. Massá Ma-chan went in 1963 to the Namphlam, northern Mozambique Conservatory to register the fifth son, but once again denied this Chinese, with roots in Guangzhou, the transmission of the nickname to descent. José Manuel was the same as his brothers: the nickname Machon, corruption of MA-chan. The identity of José Manuel Machon, embryoly marked by this bureaucratic detail imposed by the then Portuguese Mozambique, is not only a reflection of the colonial past of Portugal, but from the beginnings of Sino-Mozambican relations. “I don't have great confusion, I tried to adapt to life,” he tells Lusa in Macau, where he has lived since he was 13. The grandfather-also MA-chan-was the one who defined that this story began in Africa, leaving China looking for better life, in the starter of the twentieth century, and settling in Nampula, alongside Sharing, a Macua woman, Mozambican ethnic group. Massá, the son -and father of José Manuel -was sent to Guangzhou at 14, to receive formal education there. When he returns to Mozambique, he is a married man with a bullet mark near his left shoulder. In China, he faced the Japanese in World War II and married a Chinese, which he met on the day of marriage, until, on the threshold of the civil war, which would victory to Mao Zedong's communists, fled. He dedicated himself to Nampula to the cucumber of the cucumber-the 'Magojojo'-and the tubar bit, which he exported to Hong Kong. The Great Return However, unable to adapt, the woman returned to Macao with her four children, where she died. Massá returned to marry, this time with a Mozambican - José Manuel came first, Carla later. When the Frelimo flag raised on the mast in Mozambique on June 25, 1975, the MA-chan-headed Macao, with a brief passage in Portugal, where they inhabited a pension paid by the then IARN. “We are nothing returned, because we have not returned anywhere, we are refugees,” says Carla Machon, residing in Portugal. “When my father heard again about communism, he fled,” says his brother, José Manuel. While speaking, bowling balls pack on the floor and travel the track to a new crash. The noise in the center of Bowling Future Bright does not seem to bother this big man, 61, fluent in Cantonese and Portuguese and president of Macao Bowling Club. “This is what keeps me stable. Instead of going to the glasses, I come here,” he notes. For Joseph, independence "it was an open openness, an opening to the world." It doesn't even talk about political reasons, but how important it was to cross half a world until you arrived in Macau. A new life In this page turn, the MA-chan/maachon family came to find, in 1976, a city with little civil presence abroad. José and Carla do not remember other Mozambicans, who began to arrive after independence, many from Portugal. Mong-Há's fortress is an old witness to Mozambique's presence in Macau. Then the Landins, Mozambican soldiers at the service of the Colonial Army were quartered, recalls journalist João Guedes, a scholar in the history of Macao. It is this historical circumstance that baptized the hill of Mong-há of “Mountain of Black Ghosts”. These troops, with the “greatest warrior instinct”, in the expression of Emperor Gungunhana, remained in Macao half a century, until around the 1960s. They were responsible, for example, by the storage of the siege gates, border of the territory with China and recurring incident place. “They passed by and faded as if they had never been,” resumes Guedes, indicating that there was no material heritage attesting this military presence. Not far from Mong-Há, but at the Riquexó restaurant, troops are still there, eternalized in photos hanging on the walls. This serves African chicken, macanese dish, whose origin is still today the target of debate. Two theories: It was created by the Portuguese chief Américo Ângelo, inspired by a trip to Mozambique. Another version realizes that, seeing the African soldiers missing roasted chicken, Americo made the dish. And the memory of macau-moca-mandamous relationships is not complete without evoking the trafficking in leaf. If, on the one hand, it is known that the Portuguese took slaves from the African colonies by settling in the doors of China, in reverse, were also sent via Macao, Chinese to work in Mozambique, often in slavery conditions. The sons were part of a migratory movement from the late nineteenth century, “to develop the Mozambican colony,” explains the professor at Joaquim Chissano University in Maputo, Fatima Papelo, who investigates Sino-Mozambican cooperation. The first group, he says, was sent in 1858 and "consisted of 30 men." More than a century later, in the struggle for Mozambican independence, Beijing supported the Liberation Front of Mozambique (Frelimo) and is one of the first countries to recognize the new sovereign state. In Macao, the reinforcement of the ties was later paid, with the transition from the territory of Portugal to China in 1999. But for José Manuel, Mozambique was always present. The last time it went, tells, visited and cleaned the family campaign, "there at Machamba". "It's a Chinese custom," he explained.

item.title: FRC | Debate around the ICC Arbitral Tribunal takes place today
item.description:
Integrated in the “reflections on the afternoon” cycle, today's conversation at the Rui Cunha Foundation revolves around the Arbitral Tribunal of the International Chamber of Commerce and the connection to the local legal community, with four interveners: Winnie Wat, Ana Coimbra Trigo, Mariana Esteves and Fatima Dermawan
The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) hosts today, from 6.30 pm, the “Arbitral Court of the ICC: linking to the legal community of Macao”, dedicated to discussing the International Court of Arbitration, as “world leader arbitral institution” and its connection to local reality. According to a press release, “since 1923 [which this entity] has helped to resolve disputes in international commercial and investment disputes”, and the Court administers “arbitration exercising judicial supervision of arbitral procedures, ensuring the proper application of the 2021 arbitration rules and assisting the parties and referees”. “These efforts are supported by the Court Secretariat, consisting of more than 100 lawyers and employees, operating in offices in Paris, New York, Sao Paulo, Singapore, Abu Dhabi and Hong Kong,” he says, and today's panel “aims to present to the Macao legal community the operation of the ICC International Arbitration Court [International Trade Chamber] to explain the role of the secretariat and the court in their arbitration services and ADR. The debate also aims to present “an overview of the legal framework of arbitration in Macao and its latest developments”, and it serves the interest of “companies, internal and external lawyers, government officials, judges, teachers and students who are interested in learning about ICC or participating in ICC arbitration in the future, such as lawyers, experts or referees”. The voices of reason In these “reflections on the afternoon” participate Winnie Wat, deputy counselor of the Secretariat of the International Arbitration Chamber of Trade. He is accredited as a member of the Chartered Institute of Arbitators (FCIB) since 2021 and mediator of the Litigation Resolution Center (CEDR). Also noteworthy is the participation of Ana Coimbra Trigo, senior associate in the area of ​​dispute resolution of the Portuguese Law Firm PLMJ Law Firm. With 10 years of experience, he regularly participates as a lawyer and secretary of the Court in international and national arbitration and related legal proceedings, as well as other civil and commercial disputes, including postfusions and acquisitions, telecommunications, energy, aviation and real estate. In addition, he is a member of the ICC International Arbitration Court for Macao and University Teacher. Mariana Afonso Esteves, another of the speakers, has been a C&C Advogados & Notary senior lawyer since 2009. Its areas of action have encompassed litigation and dispute resolution, mediation and arbitration, game law, insurance, family law, as well as administrative and public law. Fátima Dermawan is an assistant legal advisor at Game Operator Sands China, where he supervises the company's Litigation Department. Fatima has a degree in Law from the Faculty of Law of the New University of Lisbon and Master from the Harvard Law School, exercising law in Portugal since 2013, in Macao since 2016 and in the state of New York since 2020.

item.title: Rainfall | Floods leave tens of thousands of displaced
item.description: The intense rains that have plagued various southern and downtown China regions since the beginning of last week have affected at least 300,000 people and forced tens of thousands of residents, especially in Guangdong province. In the village of Huaiji, one of the most affected zones, the rains caused flooding of up to three meters deep, leaving half of the local roads. Images released on state television show muddy and neighbors and volunteers streets working in their cleaning. item.title: Economy | Inflation slowed to 0.19% in May
item.description: Inflation in Macao slowed in May, was announced on Friday, but the region escaped the fall in consumer prices, something that took place for the fourth consecutive month in the interior of China. The Consumer Price Index (IPC) in Macau rose 0.19 percent in May, in homologous terms, slower than the amount recorded in April (0.23 percent), according to official data released by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). Although the CPI has dropped 0.05 percent compared to April, the territory escaped for the third consecutive month of deflation (annual fall in consumer prices). Deflation reflects weakness in domestic consumption and investment and is particularly severe, as a drop in the price of assets, as awarded to credit, generates an imbalance between the value of loans and bank guarantees. China, by far Macao's largest commercial partner, has been in consecutive months in deflation after the IPC has retreated 0.1 percent in May, the same amount recorded in April and March. According to Macao DSEC data, the deceleration of inflation in May is due to the cost of meals acquired away from home, which rose only 1.39 percent, while the expenditures on apartment mortgages increased only 0.42 percent. The housing price index fell 11.7 percent last year, notwithstanding Macau's monetary authority approved three interest rates in the last three months of 2024. Despite the increase in the number of visitors, the region registered a 2.5 percent drop in the price of clothing and footwear.

item.title: Elections | “Soldier of Mao” claims innocent and says he was six days unable to take a shower
item.description:
Accused of electoral corruption and having an illegal Mahjong business, Wong Wai Man yesterday returned to the load to cry out his innocence. The president of the Iron and Steel Shipowners Association says he was “provoked” to climb to the roof where he was a few hours, and was six days without being able to bathe or change clothes
The panorama of the legislative elections for the hemicycle already boils. In addition to these elections with the smallest number of candidate lists since the creation of the MSAR, the controversy is installed with the almost candidate Wong Wai Man, who tried to submit his candidacy without success. Also known as the “Soldier of Mao” and “Captain of Macao”, and after being accused of electoral corruption and having an illegal Mahjong business, behold, Wong Wai Man returned to the cargo to explain: refuses the accusations that he is targeted, says he was persecuted by the authorities and refers to “torture” the way he was treated when his detention. The president of the Iron and Steel Association was on Monday, several hours on a roof of a house made with a metal plate in the mud, having been rescued by the Fire Department. A solution that says it was “provoked” after being detained by the Judiciary Police (PJ), referred to the Public Prosecution Service and receiving the Commissioner's Call against Corruption (CCAC), which accuses him of having the illegal business. Wong Wai Man explained that, shortly after leaving the CCAC Office in the Nape area, he was intercepted by an employee of this body that alleged the lack of signature in some documents. However, not satisfied with the situation, Wong Wai Man picked up a taxi towards the mud, eventually taking refuge on the roof. "I had no other option, CCAC wanted to chase me to death. So I was on the roof," he explained. Regarding accusations of electoral corruption, man says he is poor and is unable to commit such illegalities. Regarding Mahjong's alleged illegal business, Wong Wai Man stressed that the Association's headquarters in fact has Mahjong tables, but only for the enjoyment of the partners. Regarding the use of money in these games, Wong Wai Man said there was always a sign to say that it was forbidden to be bets on money and that there was, at the association's headquarters, a box for donations, but that was intended for voluntary support of the members to help the association's operation. This is because, according to this, besides being president is also the only one to support all expenses of the Association of Iron and Steel shipowners, namely those related to income, water and light, considering that since 2014 that the entity has not received subsidies. One thing is certain: the association's headquarters will close doors tomorrow due to the end of the lease. Wong Wai Man says that for now, he will not look for a new address for the association because, for now, he has a more pressing subject: looking for a place to live. Wong Wai Man made the association's headquarters to his home. Life lesson Despite having missed the opportunity to submit a list and be a candidate for elections for the Legislative Assembly by Via Direct, Wong Wai Man argued that the most important thing was to participate in the whole process and learn new things. The "captain of Macao" also said that he is dedicated to society of heart and not by selfishness. Your ideal is to do things justly for society, since it argues that traditional associations do not defend the people. Wong Wai Man also told journalists a personal episode to justify their participation in social and public causes. "In 2007 my wife was pregnant and the hospitals convinced her to end her pregnancy because the baby's survival rate would be 50 percent, due to the fact that a fetal anomaly was detected after the exams. I insisted and the government eventually paid the operation worth 70 thousand patacas. So I want to make my contribution to repay a favor" to heaven "," he said. Six days without bathing According to the All About Macau newspaper, Wong Wai Man reported that he was still six days without bathing and sleeping, having remained a week missing until he performed with CCAC this Monday. Before he did, he said he was a total of six days detained, which for himself was “torture”, and that in total was all this time without bathing, sleeping or changing clothes. On Sunday, you will have been able to go home. "Last night [Tuesday] I finally managed to sleep well and bathe. I was six days without being able to bathe or change my clothes," he explained. The climb to the roof of the house in the mud was also a form of protest by the way it was treated, he said. The detention took place at dawn last Wednesday, the 11th, between 3 am and 4 am, with the argument that Wong Wai Man would maintain an illegal Mahjong business. It was then that he was detained for 48 hours in a squad in the mud, and was then transferred to the Public Prosecution Service (MP) to continue to make statements. After this process, he was notified to present himself with CCAC, having signed the requested documents. He was then arrested again for another 48 hours and transferred again to the MP. When, already on the street, he was again informed that he would have to return to CCAC to sign more documents, decided to escape and take refuge on the roof.

item.title: Breast Cancer | Research of one does “revolutionary discovery”
item.description:
A study by a team led by two professors at the University of Macao seeks answers to combat breast cancer. Academics concluded that cancer cells spread mainly through the lymphatic system, not by the bloodstream
“The lymphatic system is the main route for breast cancer dissemination and metastasis, revealed by tracking unique cell lineage” is a scientific article that seeks to increase knowledge that allows you to find solutions to the disease. The work was developed by a research team led by the full professor Chuxia Deng and assistant professor Miao Kai at the University of Macao Faculty of Health Sciences (one) and, according to a note from UM, is a “revolutionary discovery in the study of cancer metastases”. Thus, and for the first time, “a qualitative and quantitative analysis of breast cancer metastases was made, and was applied by scientists“ a barcode system based on an unique cell lineage tracking approach ”called Celltag. With this method, results were obtained that reveal that "cancer cells spread mainly through the lymphatic system, not by the bloodstream." In addition, he points out one, “research also found that interaction between tumor cells and the tumor microenvironment (TME) determines the metastatic potential of cancer cells”, ie whether or not they may easily reproduce. In this sense, “the study systematically demonstrates the roads of tumor metastases and opens new ways for the development of cancer treatment strategies”, is described. The article was published in the magazine “Molecular Cancer” and is the result of an investigation by a vast team, consisting of Kai Miao, Aíping Zhang, Xiaodan Yang, Yipeng Zhang, Anqi Lin, Lijian Wang, Xin Zhang, Heng Sun, Jun Xu, Yuzhao Feng, Fangyuan Shao, Sen Guo, Zhihui Weng, Peng Luo, Xiaoling Xu and Ch -xia Deng. Highlight for the collaboration of scientists from other higher education institutions in the region, such as Aiping Zhang, Hong Kong-Shenzhen Hospital University, and Jingyao Zhang and Shuai Gao, linked to China Agricultural University in Beijing. In turn, Dong Wang and Xiao-Yang Zhao are linked to Southern Medical University's School of Basic Medical Sciences in Guangzhou. Microenvironment is an important factor One explains, in the same statement, that the study in question “provides empirical evidence for the route preference in cancer metastasis”, demonstrating that tumor cells are “pre-programmed” with “intrinsic information that determines their metastatic potential”, and these cells “adapt dynamically their genetic expression based on the target organs”. Thus, "these findings establish the foundations for the development of therapies directed to lymphatic metastasis, such as the inhibition of cytokine signaling or the interruption of communication between tumor and stroma to suppress metastasis." In the investigation, the “single cell RNA sequencing technology” was used, which allowed the team to “discover that genetically identical tumor cells exhibit profiles of specific genetic expression of the organ”, so the microenvironment proves to be “fundamental in the formation of tumor cell behavior”. "For example, pulmonary metastatic cells positively regulate oxidative stress -related genes, while hepatic metastatic cells activate metabolic regulatory pathways," is referred to. The danger of metastases One points out that, in cancer diseases, metastases are the main cause of death. However, to date, "the mechanisms that govern the selection of the route" of these same metastases remained "obscure." “Using Celltag technology, the research team traced the spread of breast cancer cells on mice models,” discovered that “less than 3 percent of cancer cells spread throughout the bloodstream, while more than 80 percent metasta through the lymphatic system for distant organs such as lungs and liver”. Thus, "more in-depth analysis has shown that lymph spread cells have distinct genetic expression patterns and communicate closely with stromal cells, such as endothelial fibroblasts and cells in the microenvironment, forming an adaptive" seed-solo "mechanism." Looking at the study, the authors explain that cancer metastasis “is a process in which the tumor cells of the primary tumor invade the basal membrane of the blood or lymphatic vessels (intravasation), travel the blood or lymphatic system and colonize distant organs and tissues to continue their development”. Several studies point to the fact that metastases are responsible for 70 to 90 percent of cancer -related mortality, and “the dissemination of tumor cells in the vasculature and lymphatic vessels occurs simultaneously in the vast majority of cancers”. Blood roads In the discussion of the results, the study authors say that, in general terms, “tumor cells metastatize mainly through blood circulation and lymphatic system”, and until the publication of this work had been performed “numerous studies to distinguish the role of both systems in the various phases of cancer metastasis”, without knowing “which way’ for metastasis ”. It is referred to in the article, citing other studies that “cancer cells enter the bloodstream through intravasation to become CTCs [Circulating Tumor Cells-Tumor Cells in circulation], having revealed highly correlated with the survival results of breast cancer patients”. The authors also explain that “the lymphatic system is considered critical for metastasis”, as “melanoma cells with lymphatic experience were more resistant to iron and more metastases”, and in cases of “cancer tumor resection, cancer cells can further spread the lymph nodes for blood vessels and form tumors and forming tumors. metastatic in the lungs ”. To date, “although metastatic dissemination was viable by both ways, the relative importance of each process for a certain type of cancer and the target organ was unknown due to the lack of adequate quantitative tools”, something to which this study, using the celltag system, intended to respond. Thus, “we demonstrate that most lung and liver metastatic cells can be detected in the lymphatic system rather than CTCs [circulation tumor cells] derived from the blood, indicating that lymphatic vessels can be the favorite way for tumor cell metastasis, at least in breast cancer”. The authors promise not to stop here in the discovery of the course made by the metastasis of carcinogenic cells, having already performed "preliminary tests" with some cells in order to find out the possibility of "drastic" reduction of tumor cells disseminated by lymphatic. "We will continue to work on this to deepen the lymphatic dissemination mechanism and explore therapeutic interruptions in our future efforts," he is mentioned.

item.title: Commerce | CUPPA Coffee manager calls for support to Portuguese companies
item.description:
The story of Cuppa Coffee dates back to 2008 when it was hard to find a space in Macau to drink good coffee. The location in the old mud brought fame to the project, but the space ended up closing doors and moving to Studio City. João Incarnation, who manages coffee, speaks of the news and the importance of supporting Lusophone matrix projects
It all started in the mind of Portuguese Cristiana Figueiredo, at a time when for a Portuguese or passionate about coffee living in Macau it was hard to find a space to enjoy this drink accompanied by bakery or pastry products, in good Portuguese way. Cristiana Figueiredo said, in an interview with the Macao Commerce and Investment Promotion Institute (Ipim), which led her to invest in this type of business. "In Europe, people have a habit to go to coffee and to work for work. When I came to Macau for over 20 years, I realized that the Portuguese coffee culture is not popular in Macao, so I was born the idea of ​​opening a coffee in Macao, hoping to promote the food and culture of Portuguese coffee." Since 2008, Cuppa Coffee, associated with the initial project of the businesswoman, Nata Bakery, founded in 2007 and focused on bakery and pastry products, has become one of the favorite spaces of the Portuguese, foreign and even resident of the territory. However, the direction of the economic environment, with greater difficulties in paying lace, has dictated some transformations to the project, which now ends doors to the entrance of Taipa Velha and also with Lakes Nam Van, to be only in the Studio City venture in Cotai. The closure in the lakes Nam Van took place in January. At HM, João Incarnation, director and shareholder of the company that generates Cuppa Coffee, explains that, in fact, the change to the Cotai was decided for a long time. "I often say that there was no change to Studio City, because this was a plan that already existed and that came regardless of the taipa store closure. We would always open this space regardless of whether we continue, or not, with the store in the mud, whose closure was due to a failed negotiation regarding space income." Segundo João Encarnação, que hoje gere a empresa com Nicole Massa Helm, ambos consideraram que “na situação económica actual não havia condições para continuar naquele espaço, que é relativamente grande e tinha os seus custos”. “Precisávamos de fazer alguma contenção se queríamos que o negócio continuasse a funcionar, porque a alternativa é sempre fechar completamente. Não desistimos da ideia de abrir qualquer coisa na Taipa e de estarmos um pouco mais próximos dos nossos clientes regulares e mais fiéis, pelo que continuamos com esse propósito de abrir outro estabelecimento na Taipa que possa servir os clientes que lá vivem. Portanto, não há propriamente uma deslocação para o Studio City”, adiantou João Incarnation. The director and shareholder understands that this change always causes some nostalgia. “We pity it to have closed it. It cost us, we really have a lot of pity,” he confessed. "It was a decision that could have been made longer, at least a year, but we still tried to keep the establishment there, but we were not possible. We will see what the future reserves us." Despite these changes, Cuppa Coffee can be considered a successful case. "It worked there for many years and it worked well. This is a business that has to have certain conditions to work because, as we know, it has a lot of movement, but with little performance regarding each client. It is a business that needs many customers to support themselves, and for many years, at the level of rent values ​​and everything else, suppliers, for example, was much cheaper and things worked better," he recalls. The location in Taipa Velha gave Cuppa Coffee “a very large recognition and clientele”, despite the growing difficulties. "As prices were increasing, we also needed to increase our prices, but never in proportion to the increase in expenses. There was a time when we could not continue," he assumed. What the future reserves João Incarnation ensures that what customers have always sought in this space will continue in Studio City: good coffee and pastry products, with the presence of Portugal. "We always try to introduce new products. We created a new, coffee and coconut -based drink, which is excellent. We also introduced the" Nata Bomb ", a Milkshake Beat Concept flavored Nata, a true bomb," he described. There are also “traditional Portuguese products that did not exist before, such as bay bread”, as well as the donuts with different flavors, “to complete the offer we have”. "Our offer is already so varied that, even without introducing more products, it is sufficient to satisfy the values ​​of Portuguese customers and others as well." John Incarnation also said that the change of establishment to Studio City was born from an invitation. “We don't know how to run yet, it's a bet that we are making right now”, and the goal is always to go back to street coffee. "The concept of having a neighborhood store or on the street is something that interests us a lot and we are already seeing other possibilities," he added. "I don't have enough data to at this moment tell you that the change to Studio City is a winning bet. It's different, just like the concept, and we will have another type of customers beyond the usual." A “Heart” project Looking back, John Incarnation says that, for example, major problems have never been registered with human resources. "To this day we do not feel the big problem with lack of labor, it has never been something that has greatly affected us. Nowadays it is not as easy as it used to have quotas [for non-resident workers], as there are enough places that need placement. It is able to be easier, at this time, to get more local workers than before," he said, confirming that lace remain to be the big problem for such business. “Cuppa Coffee is a project of the heart and during the pandemic I realized that I was going to close. I also realized that there was a series of closures, almost simultaneously, from other Portuguese establishments. Talk to my partner, who has a lot of experience in this area, and told him that I liked to try to keep Cuppa Coffee open. Possible to continue exactly the same concept and the same quality as it had been having with Cristiana, who did an excellent work in the creation and growth of Cuppa Coffee. ” Overcoming the pandemic years, and at a time when Macau faces a break in local consumption, João Incarnation says that "it fulfills a bit to the Portuguese community to make the possible to support the effort we do so that everything is still open." “I am not just about Cuppa Coffee, but also from wheat d'old, butter, Portuguese restaurants and Lord Stow, which is not a typical Portuguese business is based on Portuguese culture. All of these businesses have to be fed and supported. For our part, we must maintain quality, but the Portuguese community has to take advantage of what exists and support the Portuguese business.” Despite the breach of consumption by the places, João Incarnation says that a balance with the consumption of tourists is guaranteed. "We feel a little [Break of consumption], but we can counterbalance with the offers we do and that satisfy the taste of local Chinese and visitors. But of course [consumer breakage] has, of course, impact on business, not just the Portuguese, and this is in the city. But I think there is still some critical mass to keep Portuguese business open," he said.

item.title: History | The MA-chan escape to the colonial and macau
item.description:
The MA-chan family is from Mozambique with Chinese roots, sought its new path in the then colonial Portugal and since 1976 that set roots in Macao. José Manuel Machon, resident in the territory since he was 13, told Lusa the very peculiar trajectory of his family, which reflects many of the family directions taken in the years of war and the end of the Portuguese colonial empire
The MA-chan, the Mozambican family with roots in China, fled twice to communism and twice resumed in colonial Portugal. In 1976, they landed in Macao, where Mozambique's memory had erased with the departure of the Landins, African troops that parked in the territory for decades since 1912. According to a report by Luís Andrade de Sá published in Macau magazine in 1992, and quoted by the blog "Chronicles Macanese", the Landins were in Macao "for about five decades", and "the Chinese never used to their conviviality, suspiciously who had the huge blacks who played a horrible drumsticks while returning the ostensiva. ferocity ”. The term Landim became a reference “to identify all indigenous battalions that passed by Macau”, is described in the same report. Massá Ma-chan went in 1963 to the Namphlam, northern Mozambique Conservatory to register the fifth son, but once again denied this Chinese, with roots in Guangzhou, the transmission of the nickname to descent. José Manuel was the same as his brothers: the nickname Machon, corruption of MA-chan. The identity of José Manuel Machon, embryoly marked by this bureaucratic detail imposed by the then Portuguese Mozambique, is not only a reflection of the colonial past of Portugal, but from the beginnings of Sino-Mozambican relations. “I don't have great confusion, I tried to adapt to life,” he tells Lusa in Macau, where he has lived since he was 13. The grandfather-also MA-chan-was the one who defined that this story began in Africa, leaving China looking for better life, in the starter of the twentieth century, and settling in Nampula, alongside Sharing, a Macua woman, Mozambican ethnic group. Massá, the son -and father of José Manuel -was sent to Guangzhou at 14, to receive formal education there. When he returns to Mozambique, he is a married man with a bullet mark near his left shoulder. In China, he faced the Japanese in World War II and married a Chinese, which he met on the day of marriage, until, on the threshold of the civil war, which would victory to Mao Zedong's communists, fled. He dedicated himself to Nampula to the cucumber of the cucumber-the 'Magojojo'-and the tubar bit, which he exported to Hong Kong. The Great Return However, unable to adapt, the woman returned to Macao with her four children, where she died. Massá returned to marry, this time with a Mozambican - José Manuel came first, Carla later. When the Frelimo flag raised on the mast in Mozambique on June 25, 1975, the MA-chan-headed Macao, with a brief passage in Portugal, where they inhabited a pension paid by the then IARN. “We are nothing returned, because we have not returned anywhere, we are refugees,” says Carla Machon, residing in Portugal. “When my father heard again about communism, he fled,” says his brother, José Manuel. While speaking, bowling balls pack on the floor and travel the track to a new crash. The noise in the center of Bowling Future Bright does not seem to bother this big man, 61, fluent in Cantonese and Portuguese and president of Macao Bowling Club. “This is what keeps me stable. Instead of going to the glasses, I come here,” he notes. For Joseph, independence "it was an open openness, an opening to the world." It doesn't even talk about political reasons, but how important it was to cross half a world until you arrived in Macau. A new life In this page turn, the MA-chan/maachon family came to find, in 1976, a city with little civil presence abroad. José and Carla do not remember other Mozambicans, who began to arrive after independence, many from Portugal. Mong-Há's fortress is an old witness to Mozambique's presence in Macau. Then the Landins, Mozambican soldiers at the service of the Colonial Army were quartered, recalls journalist João Guedes, a scholar in the history of Macao. It is this historical circumstance that baptized the hill of Mong-há of “Mountain of Black Ghosts”. These troops, with the “greatest warrior instinct”, in the expression of Emperor Gungunhana, remained in Macao half a century, until around the 1960s. They were responsible, for example, by the storage of the siege gates, border of the territory with China and recurring incident place. “They passed by and faded as if they had never been,” resumes Guedes, indicating that there was no material heritage attesting this military presence. Not far from Mong-Há, but at the Riquexó restaurant, troops are still there, eternalized in photos hanging on the walls. This serves African chicken, macanese dish, whose origin is still today the target of debate. Two theories: It was created by the Portuguese chief Américo Ângelo, inspired by a trip to Mozambique. Another version realizes that, seeing the African soldiers missing roasted chicken, Americo made the dish. And the memory of macau-moca-mandamous relationships is not complete without evoking the trafficking in leaf. If, on the one hand, it is known that the Portuguese took slaves from the African colonies by settling in the doors of China, in reverse, were also sent via Macao, Chinese to work in Mozambique, often in slavery conditions. The sons were part of a migratory movement from the late nineteenth century, “to develop the Mozambican colony,” explains the professor at Joaquim Chissano University in Maputo, Fatima Papelo, who investigates Sino-Mozambican cooperation. The first group, he says, was sent in 1858 and "consisted of 30 men." More than a century later, in the struggle for Mozambican independence, Beijing supported the Liberation Front of Mozambique (Frelimo) and is one of the first countries to recognize the new sovereign state. In Macao, the reinforcement of the ties was later paid, with the transition from the territory of Portugal to China in 1999. But for José Manuel, Mozambique was always present. The last time it went, tells, visited and cleaned the family campaign, "there at Machamba". "It's a Chinese custom," he explained.

item.title: Entrepreneurship | Event for local companies wants to capture “angel investors”
item.description:
Macau today hosts an event designed to capture the so -called “angel investors” for local entrepreneurship projects. Macao Angel Investor Network takes place at “The Macao Young Entrepreneur Incubation Center” and aims to support emerging business projects or simply startups that are taking the first steps
It's called “Macau Angel Investor Network”, anything like “Angel Investor Network in Macao” and aims to bring residents closer who want to be successful entrepreneurs and create their own business in an economy that wants to diverse. The event is scheduled for today at Hengqin Development Center, at 517 Avenida da Praia Grande, Nam Tung commercial building, between 11h and 12h30, and has several personalities linked to the local economy, but not only. They are Raphael Chan, Deputy Director of the Directorate of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT), Paulo Andrez, Emeritus President of the “European Business Angel Network” and also figures such as Emanuel Soares, Legal Consultant, U Man Fai, angel investor for the Great Bay and Founder/founder of “Esenia Fund” and even Ung Choi Kun, former deputy to the Legislative Assembly and president of Kun Cheong Holding Ltd and also an “angel investor”. The event is developed by the Association for Entrepreneurship and Innovation for Macao, China and Portuguese-speaking countries, which is linked Marco Duarte Rizzolio, being co-organized by the Macao Sino-Buspone Platform Association for sustainable development. To HM, this explained the main objectives that are behind this initiative. "We want to connect an angel investors to startups and small and medium enterprises (SMEs), fostering the entrepreneurial ecosystem and promoting the economic diversification of Macao." In turn, Alvin Fong, also linked to the organization of this event and president of Direch International, argued that it is intended to “create a platform that brings together knowledge about angel investments, helping in the diversification of Macao's economy”. According to Rizzolio, "Investors Angel, who invest capital in emerging companies, are fundamental to support startups in early stages where financing possibilities are more scarce in the traditional financial sector." “In addition,” he said, the contact network that now runs on Praia Grande Avenue “seeks to bring investors closer to Portuguese -speaking and China countries, creating mutual access to the best projects developed in these regions and reinforcing Macao as a strategic link between the East and the West”. For Alvin Fong, this is the "opportune moment" for the holding of such an event, given that "the world is going through many changes and new opportunities are emerging." According to Marco Duarte Rizzolio, in Macao have already occurred in previous events in an attempt to capture angel investments, "but this is the first time it is intended to create a" Business Angels "network in Macao with Chinese investors and Portuguese -speaking countries." "The conditions to hold this event now arise from various factors, such as the rapid growth of innovation and technology, the greater digitization and the use of software in business, the need to diversify the local economy, the growing focus on the great bay as a pole of innovation," he said. At issue, there are also factors such as “the joint effort of public and private entities in creating an environment favorable to entrepreneurship”, something that has been greatly enhanced by the pandemic years, defended, having brought Macao and the authorities “a new understanding of the importance of supporting local and regional businesses, making this moment particularly strategic”. Who is who For today's session were invited “Successful Entrepreneurs and Entrepreneurs, some of whom are leaders in their areas”, and their “experience and intelligence add a lot to this event,” said Alvin Fong. Already Marco Duarte Rizzolio, stressed that will be present "people interested in technology and innovation, including some angel investors, representatives of risk capital funds, renowned entrepreneurs and specialists in innovation and business development." Today's session is an “opportunity to obtain valuable knowledge and expand the network of contacts”, and Marco Duarte Rizzo highlights personalities such as Paulo Andrez, “recognized international expert in entrepreneurship, innovation and angel investment”, or Ung Choi Kun, “prominent figure in Macao in real estate and education sectors, and also an angel investor in several companies”. Asked about the main areas in which this initiative is focused on, Rizzolio adds that the event is focused on “startups and SMEs that act on sectors such as technology, intelligent tourism, green economy, health, digital education, logistics or finance”, because they are “sectors with high growth potential and that are aligned in local needs”, namely in the “1+” economic diversification strategy or “1+4” strategy global trends ”. "We want to identify innovative companies that can thrive not only in Macau, but also in the big bay and in international markets," added this official who is also linked to the organization of the startup and entrepreneurship contest, the "929 Challenge". Right moment For Alvin Fong, Macao currently presents potentialities for the connection of business projects to the cities of the Great Bay, all located in Guangdong Province. "Macau has a lot of freedom and flexibility to experience new ideas. In addition, we have received many tourists from around the world. Being one of GBA's eleven cities, Macau is, in fact, an excellent platform," he said. In turn, Marco Duarte Rizzolio speaks of “unique characteristics” of the territory, “like their position as a bridge between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, a stable regulatory environment and tax and financial incentives that can attract investors and startups”. There is also “the increase in the focus on the diversification of the economy beyond the game sector”, verifying “a fertile ground for innovation and new business”. "In a global scenario of low interest rates, capital markets with some geopolitical friction, investment in technology has presented multiple incomparable from other assets. In this context, the creation of more financial incentives and the strengthening of startup support programs are crucial steps," said the event co-creator. Great competition Despite the potential, the challenges persist, given that “Macao does not have many advantages beyond the game sector,” there is “intense competition in the big bay,” warned Alvin Fong. For Marco Duarte Rizzolio "Challenges are significant," because "the transition from an economy so dependent on the game sector to a more diverse model takes time and requires coordinated efforts." It is also necessary to take into account the opportunities that arise with the integration of MSar on Hengqin Island, said Rizzolio, who recalls, however, “the challenges related to competitiveness and regulatory adaptation”. "In addition, housing and commercial remodeling requires balance between economic growth and the preservation of local social fabric. It is essential to create policies that encourage entrepreneurship and investment, minimizing the negative impacts of these transformations," he said. Asked whether the authorities have been enough to capture angel investors, both argue that there is more work to do. "This is a good start, but more can be done in the future," said Alvin Fong. Already Marco Duarte Rizzolio, said that "the Government of MSAR has made important efforts", as well as mentioning "several times the need to create a" Business Angels "network." “Macau has supported many initiatives that aim to stimulate investment. It is true that the creation of more financial incentives and the strengthening of startup support programs are crucial steps. It is also necessary to promote Macau more actively as an attractive destination for investors, highlighting its competitive advantages on the international scene. This event is an example of good collaboration between the public and private sector to stimulate ecosystem,” said Rizzolio. Also noteworthy is that today's close connection with 369, an entity that aims to become “an international hub of science and technology in Macau, giving new generations a greater stage of exploration” of opportunities, ”said Alvin Fong, president of this entity. Marco Duarte Rizzolio stressed that we are facing “an incubator of the Macao ecosystem that has organized several events”.

item.title: June 10 | Alexandre Leitão highlights the end of the waiting lists at the Consulate
item.description:
Yesterday was held at the consular residence in Bela Vista, the usual celebration ceremony of June 10-Portugal, Camões and the Portuguese Communities. Alexandre Leitão, Consul, highlighted the end of the waiting lists in the consulate and the modernization of some services, noting that Portugal is ready to promote stronger economic ties with the MSAR
After years when renewing the citizen card or passport could be a small major problem for Portuguese citizens to reside in the MSAR, since this subject seems to be solved. Alexandre Leitão, Portuguese consul-general in Macao and Hong Kong, proved yesterday to be a satisfied man to talk about the last achievements achieved in the operation of the Portuguese Consulate-General in Macau and Hong Kong, this regards the June 10th, Portugal, Camões and Portuguese Communities celebrations. "After two years of intense concentration in the normalization of consular services, we eliminated waiting lists in the field of issuing citizen cards and passports," he said. According to Alexandre Leitão, "users have returned access to 90 percent of services without prior appointment, we introduced electronic payment, we drastically reduce response and referral times after the admission of processes, and reorganize human resources and procedures." The consul did not forget the consulate's team, "which is constituted, almost in full, by macanese who have positively reacted to the successive challenges that have been presented to them," also noting that "in 15 months were issued or renewed 55,000 citizen cards and passports, which also demonstrates the size of the Portuguese community of Macau and Hong Kong." Portugal with value Thus, the official said he could “safely say that the essential, from the strictly consular point of view, is done”, but intends to bet on the “deepening of Portugal's diplomatic, economic and cultural relations with the special administrative regions” of Macau and Hong Kong. Addressing the Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, Alexandre Leitão recalled that the ruler “has defended the acceleration of the opening and diversification of the economy” and that from this point of view Portugal has a privileged role to fulfill. "Portugal has the same purpose, which makes us, once again, bridged in a common purpose: to grow and diversify our economies, internationalizing them for the benefit of our peoples. Portuguese companies are prepared to take advantage of the" most open and inclusive posture to intensify international ties and increase global projection and attractiveness and the renowned Macao as an international metropolis "," Since, they are aware of the contribution of Portuguese companies and workers to the growth and quality of Macao economy services ”. The consul was still clear in saying Sam Hou Fai that "he can count on the Portuguese community to actively participate in the ambitious design of economic diversification of MSAR." Alexandre Leitão did not forget the last major Chinese investment in Portugal, namely in Sines, by Calb - China Aviation Lithium Battery, being “the largest of the decade”, which “demonstrates the confidence of the large Chinese and the world's quality and capacity of Portugal as an investment destination”. Camões, the Great Given that there are numerous celebrations of the 500th anniversary of the birth of Luís Vaz de Camões, Sam Hou Fai brought the Portuguese poet to his speech at yesterday's ceremony in Bela Vista. “The strong and deep historical ties between Portugal and Macau are already known to all, and are reflected on this day, because today is also celebrating the largest Portuguese poet who lived a few years in Macao and was part of the first moments of this historical meeting of two peoples.” "It is never too much to remember that it is because of this centenary meeting of cultures, in this" outdoor window "of China, that the" uniqueness "of Macao arises as" the only place in the world whose official languages ​​", as expressly underlined by President XI Jinping," said the chief executive. Sam Hou Fai has not yet forgotten the “commitment and commitment of the Government of MSA in the concentration of efforts to build a higher level opening platform”, as well as the “reinforcement of bilateral opening with Lusophony and promoting comprehensive mutual benefits cooperation that enriches and further widen the role and functions of Macao as a sino-illusion platform”. item.title: Satellite Casinos | Government says that closing impact will be controlled
item.description:
It is official: the 11 satellite casinos will even end the doors until December 31 this year, and Melco and the Macao Game Society have already announced the restructuring plans. Regarding the affected workers, the government presents numbers lower than those already mentioned by deputies and associations: 5,600. An impact on SMEs is still expected, but without a major consequence for banks
After much speculation, here is finally the authorities and operators have announced what will actually happen to the 11 satellite casinos operated in the territory. They all will close, and the Macau Game Society (SJM) Resorts and Melco have already defined the plans for what follows [see secondary text], which includes acquisitions of L'ARC and Bridge 16, as well as the transfer of workers and game machines. The executive presented yesterday, at a press conference, numbers of workers affected with the closing of the satellite casinos below those already referred to by sector associations. It will, after all, will be 5,600 and no more than ten thousand as some deputies said to these entities, and from this cake, 4,800 workers were directly hired by the operators of the game, so if the satellite casino, they can be integrated into their paintings. The rest, 800, were contracted directly by the satellite casinos themselves. There are still 400 non -resident workers (TNR) involved in this process. With regard to Mocha Clubs, 300 local workers and 50 TNR. Tai Kin IP, secretary for the economy and finance, said that "the data were collected by different means", but that the government calculations "are official". "As the other means came to this data, I don't know," he added. Asked about the support of these 800 workers, the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, explained that "the owners of the satellite casinos have the responsibility to ensure the work relationship of these people." "In the case of the 4,800 hired by the dealers, such as Croupiers or Treasury Employees, they can return to work in these dealers' casinos. In relation to 800, the concessionaires have guaranteed the government that if they have employment problems they can absorb them and provide adequate jobs on the properties of the dealers," he said. Representative Song Pek Kei even talked about the possibility of about 15,000 unemployed, while Nick Law, in a plenary intervention, said that among the satellite casinos and associated stores, there were "13,500 workers", representing "4.6 percent of the total macao work force". POSSIBILITY OF CONVERSION Regarding small and medium-sized companies (SMEs) located in the neighborhoods that will no longer have these satellite casinos, namely in areas such as the Inner Port, Zape, Nape or Fishermen's Dock, the government predicts some impact but controlled. There are, in total, 320 stores that operate in the vicinity with 800 workers, and “about 400 workers will have another employment situation according to the reconversion of stores,” said Secretary Tai Kin IP. Essentially, and after the government's surveys, half of the 320 stores "will be affected directly by the satellite casinos closure, such as the pledge houses, mobile phones, restaurants and jewelery." However, Tai Kin IP pointed out that there will be others that will not have a great impact on depending on sales to residents. Above all, the ruler pointed out that this scenario may even constitute an opportunity. "It will be a challenge and an opportunity for the reconversion of stores. Traditional stores that have a close relationship with satellite casinos customers have to reconvert. Highlight that Hospitality Consultant Savills referred in March that the satellite casinos closure would devalue the hotels in 60 percent and cause more non-compliance with the SMEs, with bank credit obligations valued between 25 and 39 billion. Tai Kin IP devalued this scenario. “From the knowledge we have, the loans granted to satellite casinos involve less than 1 percent of all bank loan activity, and we find that the risks are very limited to the operation of banks. In terms of risk supervision indicators in the financial industry, such as capital flow and others, banks' behavior will be safe and stable.” Regarding the SMEs, Tai Kin IP said that the monetary and currency of Macao is “closely monitoring the situation with the banks to mitigate the recovery of customers”, and the secretary in advance that in April, “ten billion patacas were injected to loans to the SMEs, attenuating their pressures”. Asked about the timing of these measures, André Cheong said it is the right time. "It all depends on the dealerships' decisions and we now officially receive the decision. This is a problem that has to do with several casinos and a considerable number of workers, and we did not want that only at the end of the year they knew about their situation. With six months to finish the transition period we understand that this is the indicated phase to advertise," he said. No impact on recipes Given the budgetary revision for this year with 12 billion Patacas in the forecast of game revenues, André Cheong assured that the satellite casinos closure will not have a major impact on the overview of revenues. "We made the budgetary review with less 12 billion patacas due to lack of consumption. We believe that the closure of satellite casinos does not have great impact on the game's recipes," he said. The secretary also stressed that, regarding the intention of SJM Resorts to purchase the enterprises Ponte 16 and L'ARC, the concessionaire "has to complete this acquisition procedure until December 31, and if they cannot buy these satellite casinos [who operate in the projects] have to end."

item.title: PATANE MARKET | CE hears complaints from traders
item.description:
The chief executive visited several neighborhoods of Macau, including Fai Chi Kei, Ilha Verde and the Canidroma Zone. In addition, it revealed that the possibility of connecting Qingmao is being studied to Fai Chi Kei through the light meter
The chief executive made a journey through the Macau Peninsula on Saturday, visiting several neighborhoods accompanied by secretaries of his executive. In the Patane Municipal Market, the government leader hear traders who complained about the lack of customers and weak sales. “We are living very difficult times. We can only earn 200 or 300 patacas a day, although market income is low, we can't cover expenses. If you can not solve [the problem], how can we solve?” Asked a merchant from a fresh product sales board. The saleswoman returned to the cargo and argued that online consumer habits razed the traditional trade. "Now residents do not shop in stores. After the pandemic, they only do online shopping," warned residents. "We can't close the internet, this is impossible," he replied between laughs Sam Hou Fai, commenting that "things have changed a lot." “Let's work together to try to solve the problems,” insisted the chief executive. The banking merchant next to the answer to how the businesses went to the same scenario. "The business is still difficult, it is true. The lives of residents are becoming increasingly difficult. We hope that with their leadership, the market environment can be optimized," he said. Sam Hou Fai replied that this was also his desire. Reinforcement of supports The chief executive also visited the Patane Food Center, where he spoke to residents and tourists. Sam Hou Fai encouraged traders to "constantly implement news to explore characteristics that attract more visitors." After passing through Patane, the entourage led by the chief executive went to Ilha Verde, Fai Chi Kei and surroundings, accompanied by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP. Some traders have asked Sam Hou Fai a new round of consumption prize to improve business. The Chief Executive also took the opportunity to visit the “Sanrio Character Dream Garden”, and the Feliz of Love Pavilion for the Homeland of the Directorate of Education and Youth Development Services, where he interacted with students. Regarding the “Garden of Dreams”, Tai Kin IP said that in about 80 days, the initiative “managed to divert more than 240 thousand visitors to the social neighborhood”. Finally, Sam Hou Fai visited the land of the former Yat Yuen Caniderom where the construction of a sports park is planned and was known the situation of the work, listening to a presentation of the secretary for transport and public works, Raymond Tam. The chief executive said that the “public contest of works for the first zone is scheduled to soon”. Regarding the traffic of the adjacent zones, Sam Hou Fai revealed that the works for the eastern line of the Light Metro that connects the northern part of the city to the Taipa result at a good pace. The ruler revealed that his executive "is studying the possibility of extending the line of the slight meter from the Qingmao border post to the Fai Chi Kei neighborhood, as well as the future sports park."

item.title: Government admits to increase cautions paid by travel agencies
item.description: Helena de Senna Fernandes, director of the Directorate of Tourism Services (STD), said yesterday at the Legislative Assembly (AL) that there may be an increase in the value of the security to be presented by travel agencies in the scope of the licensing of the activity. The guarantee was given in the debate on the vote, in the specialty, of the new law of activity of travel agencies and the profession of tourist guide, approved yesterday in Hemiciclo. "We have the model of security and liability insurance, which is equal to the interior of China. We will consider whether or not it is necessary to raise the amount of the deposit and perhaps there will be a slight adjustment, but I think it will not be a very large increase," said Helena de Senna Fernandes. This information arose about the intervention of Deputy José Pereira Coutinho, who suggested a change to the model composed of the payment of security and liability insurance associated with trips that are not paid by the travelers, and which is treated under the licensing process of agencies. “In Hong Kong there is a compensation fund, and in Portugal there is the Travel and Tourism Guarantee Fund. For years we use the model of security and liability insurance, there is a way to change it?” Asked the deputy. According to the Portuguese Tourism Portal, this fund “responds jointly and severally liable for the payment of the credits of travelers arising from the breach of services contracted to travel agencies”. Helena de Senna Fernandes explained that, in the case of Hong Kong, the fund is supported with a percentage of the commissions charged on the excursions, and in both territories, "in terms of the number of tourists, it is very different." No permanent licenses Another of the points addressed by the deputies, it concerns the fact that the agencies have to renew their license annually. Coutinho suggested a permanent license, but the government understands that it is up to the companies to decide according to the market panorama. "The sector is always changing, and with regard to agencies there are some that have more or less activity. We have to know what their situation is like, so we put a period of one year for license renewal," he explained. Tai Kin IP, secretary for the economy and finance, stated that “it has to do with its will” the continuity, or not, of the business by the agencies. "We have electronic services for license renewal, which greatly makes your life much easier, but agencies have to express their willingness to renew," he said.

item.title: Macau
item.description: In 2007 Pope Benedict XVI established the tradition of praying for the Catholic Church of China on May 24. On June 24, the day is celebrated when the residents of Macao repelled, in 1622, the Dutch invaders and all those who love the city should also pray for it, as in Macao there were too many unpleasant incidents lately. Bishop Stephen Lee Bun-Ssang of the Diocese of Macau wrote a pastoral letter to be read during Pentecost Sunday, which this year was celebrated on June 8, where he declared, “recently, there were several suicides and several suicide attempts in Macao. According to health services, 18 suicides were recorded in the first trimester of 2025, which evidences the urgent need for Taking measures to solve the problem. These tragedies not only bring deep pain to family members, but they also shake us all. lonely ». Unfortunately, in early May, other suicides were even more registered. The fact that they were not publicly disclosed does not mean that the tragedies did not happen. Ultimately, we release ourselves from the current depressing social atmosphere is the most effective path and, for that, we need to pray! The administrative measure that requires a person to live in Macau at least during 183 to benefit from the pecuniary reimbursement plan for economic development for the year 2025 also affected some residents who are outside the city, especially those living in Hong Kong, a city that is part of the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay. I noticed that there are in fact several opinions regarding the necessary conditions to benefit from this plan. The requirement of 183 days of permanence is not a problem in itself; The fundamental question lies in the calendar of its implementation. Last year, before the term of his mandate, former Ho Iat Seng Chief Executive announced that the pecuniary reimbursement plan for economic development for the year 2025 would not be changed, which citizens faced as good news. However, when the plan was implemented this year, the condition that determines the need to have remained in Macao in 2024, at least for 183 days, was added, which deprived some residents living outside the possibility of achieving this goal. If this measure had only had an effect from 2026, I believe it would have been less controversial and that the disagreements it caused among the residents would have been reduced. For some people, the amount of 10,000 patacas may seem insignificant, but for the very needy, especially the elders, no longer entitled to receive this value can be quite devastating. If the social atmosphere were a little more harmonious, there would be less tragedies. For this to happen, we need to pray! There are still a lot for which we have to pray. In 2022, the Legislative Assembly changed the “legal regime for the exploration of casino fortune or unlucky games”, which had a negative impact on the situation of the “satellite casinos” so most will close by the end of the year. I wonder what will be of the 4,800 employees of the game companies that work in the "satellite casinos". The doubt is and if they can maintain their current level of income or if their lives will be affected. The future of the 800 who worked on the "satellite casinos" but were not employees of the game companies, and the staff of the stores located around the satellite casinos also raises concern and it is not known if they will have any guarantee of subsistence. On the 17th, some journalists were prevented from entering the Legislative Assembly and covering the work session, an unusual event for members of the press. The subsistence of Macao residents and the maintenance of press freedom is equally important, so we pray for them! On June 24, 1622, the residents of Macao, who fought with all their strength to repel the Dutch forces, will certainly have prayed during the resistance!
