item.title: Michael Hui (II)
item.description:
Last week, we analyzed the determining factors in the success of Michael Koon-Man's films (許冠文). Michael has been a film star of the last 50 years. Since 1977. A person who dedicates 50 years to a career has demonstrated dedication, enthusiasm and recognition for his profession. Michael also understands the difference between the thinking of the oldest generation and the latest generation and used this knowledge to entertain audiences. The dialogue about love in the “Talk Show 2005 ″ is an example of this. Today, we will continue to explore the factors of the success of Michael Koon-Man movies. After the delivery ceremony of his doctorate Honoris Causa, Michael agreed to give an interview. He pointed out that he had studied sociology at the university, which allowed him to understand more deeply the influence films have on viewers. Good movies are a good influence and this is the social responsibility of cinema. Movies have to have a beneficial influence on society. As a film industry worker believes that films are not only used to benefit him financially but also to favor society. How could he do not do well? If a person wants to succeed in their profession, it is indispensable to have vision. Michael sets the example of a meal to illustrate the current Hong Kong film market. If a restaurant serves a great meal, people in the city good will spend their money to taste it; Similarly, they spend their money to watch a good movie, and the latter, "The Last Dance," is certainly a good example. But if the movie has a vulgar brake, audiences won't spend your money to see it. How do you make a good movie? One of the keys to success is the discovery of new topics. It is necessary to have the courage to choose to address a subject that has never been addressed and transform it into the argument of a movie. The theme of "The Last Dance" is a funeral. A mother who lost her son believes he can be resurrected and hires a funeral agent to wrap his body and hide it on Morgue. This behavior leads people to think that this mother is crazy in pain for the loss of her child, but also shows audiences that she is violating Chinese traditions; who argue that people must be buried in peace. At another point in the film, the funeral agent who chairs the ceremony distributes to family members and friends present, dolls made similar to the deceased and miniatures of the sports cars of his choice, to relieve the heavy atmosphere of the funeral. Few films to date have addressed this theme, which makes it a novelty. The protagonist "Hello Man" (Hello 文) of "The Last Dance" is an annoying character, but Michael said bluntly that the character makes people miss the previous generation, especially the figure of the traditional Chinese "father". Hello Man is a Taoist (道教傳人) and taught his son all the Taoist practices and rituals (道家) that must be performed in a funeral. His son disguised his reluctance to follow his father's footsteps and become a Taoist monk (道士), but because his son (Hello Man's grandson) wanted to attend a Catholic school, was baptized and became Catholic. After that, he left Hello Man, who had been paralyzed due to a stroke in Hong Kong and emigrated to Australia with his family, asking his sister to take account of his father alone. In the film, Hello Man represents the ancient generation that valued children more than daughters and does not accept religions from outside China. This is a mindset that the new generation does not accept. The film's argument illustrates the conflict between two generations simply and easy to understand, thus gaining the recognition of all and meeting the various sensitivities of the audiences. Hearings can only be attracted to prestigious films and in which they recognize themselves. Only hong Kong successful movies have the opportunity to reach the international market and only then can the world see the cinema that is made in Hong Kong. Next week, we will continue to analyze the elements that determined the success of Michael Koon-Man's movies.

item.title: FRC | Debate around the ICC Arbitral Tribunal takes place today
item.description:
Integrated in the “reflections on the afternoon” cycle, today's conversation at the Rui Cunha Foundation revolves around the Arbitral Tribunal of the International Chamber of Commerce and the connection to the local legal community, with four interveners: Winnie Wat, Ana Coimbra Trigo, Mariana Esteves and Fatima Dermawan
The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) hosts today, from 6.30 pm, the “Arbitral Tribunal of the ICC Court: connecting to the legal community of Macao”, dedicated to discussing the International Court of Arbitration, as “world leader arbitral institution” and its connection to local reality. According to a press release, “since 1923 [which this entity] has helped to resolve disputes in international commercial and investment disputes”, and the Court administers “arbitration exercising judicial supervision of arbitral procedures, ensuring the proper application of the 2021 arbitration rules and assisting the parties and referees”. “These efforts are supported by the Court Secretariat, consisting of more than 100 lawyers and employees, operating in offices in Paris, New York, Sao Paulo, Singapore, Abu Dhabi and Hong Kong,” he says, and today's panel “aims to present to the Macao legal community the operation of the ICC International Arbitration Court [International Trade Chamber] to explain the role of the secretariat and the court in their arbitration services and ADR. The debate also aims to present “an overview of the legal framework of arbitration in Macao and its latest developments”, and it serves the interest of “companies, internal and external lawyers, government officials, judges, teachers and students who are interested in learning about the ICC or participating in ICC arbitrations in the future, such as lawyers, experts or referees”. The voices of reason In these “reflections on the afternoon” participate Winnie Wat, deputy counselor of the Secretariat of the International Arbitration Chamber of Trade. He is accredited as a member of the Chartered Institute of Arbitators (FCIB) since 2021 and mediator of the Litigation Resolution Center (CEDR). Also noteworthy is the participation of Ana Coimbra Trigo, senior associate in the area of ​​dispute resolution of the Portuguese Law Firm PLMJ Law Firm. With 10 years of experience, he regularly participates as a lawyer and secretary of the Court in international and national arbitration and related legal proceedings, as well as other civil and commercial disputes, including postfusions and acquisitions, telecommunications, energy, aviation and real estate. item.title: June 10 | New Film Show this weekend
item.description:
Still about the celebrations of June 10-Portugal Day, Camões and the Portuguese communities, Casa Garden hosts, from today, a Portuguese film cycle that includes the short film “Ice Merchants”, named for the Oscars. But there are also feature films to see, in a total of five sessions

According to a statement, what is intended with this show is “not only to show Portuguese films around the world, but also to make known the proper language of national cinematography and their agents”, including directors, actors, technical teams and producers. ”It is thus proposing to“ include the participation of creative agents in this show ”, is mentioned. Today starts at 7 pm with Leonardo Mouramateus's movie “Greice”. It is a 1h10-minute movie that had a “strong international presence” last year and also this year, having premiered at the International Film Festival Rotterdam. "Greice" was screened at important film festivals such as Kino Pavasaris, Filmadrid and Transilvania Iff. In Portugal, the film won the “Best Realization Award” at the Indielisboa Festival (2024), and in the Cinema-Curitiba International Festival (2024, Brazil) won three main awards, including “Best Film Film”. Carolina Rosendo's project won some international awards and was appointed by the Portuguese Cinema Academy for the “Sophia Student Prize” this year. Also noteworthy is the display of “Atom & Void”, by Gonçalo Almeida. This fiction short of fiction, just nine minutes long, debuted at Fantastic Fest (2024) in the US, where he won an “honorable mention” of the jury. item.title: Literature | Giorgio Sinedino wins 18th edition of Special Book Award of China
item.description:
Giorgio Sinedino, a translator and synologist in Macau, won the 18th edition of the Special Book Award of China, one of the “most important China awards offered to foreigners in the field of publications,” says the central government connection office on the MSAR. This award has been awarded 20 years ago
The winner of the 18th Special Book Award of China is already known. This is Giorgio Sinedino, a synologist and translator, who was an advisor to the former Chief of Executive, Chui Sai On. Author of a vast translation work of poetry and Chinese culture, Giorgio Sinedino is a professor at the Portuguese Department of Macao. In addition, he is also a member of the Executive Council of the International Confucian Association and Member of the World Synologists Council. According to a statement issued by the Central Government's liaison office, this is “China's most important prize offered to foreigners in the field of publications”, and in 20 years, 219 translators, editors and authors from 63 countries were highlighted. The prize awarded to Giorgio Sinedino, by “his important contributions”, was handed over to the target on Tuesday in Beijing. At the ceremony, the translator highlighted “the impressions of his trajectory in the exchange between China and the Portuguese -speaking countries”, reiterating “the commitment to continuing such work”. The same note tells that Giorgio Sinedino, "in the various institutions he went through, has consistently endeavored in the dissemination of traditional Chinese culture, promoting the knowledge and understanding of this legacy abroad," and foster “dialogue and exchange of experiences between China and other civilizations”. The place of experience The same note reports the vast curriculum that Giorgio Sinedino presents in the area of ​​translation and research of Chinese classics, as since 2012, he began to publish in Brazil commented editions of writings such as “The Analects”, “Dao de Jing de Lazi with the Glossas of the Lord on the banks of the river” and “The Immortal of Southern China - a cultural reading of Zhuangzi”. "The Analects" were the "first edition commented on Portuguese to be translated directly from the archaic Chinese", and "for over ten years, it remained the only one of the genre available on the market in a western language." In addition, it is considered “a new translation classic”, having already sold 200 thousand copies. Last year, the three works referred to here won new editions in China, having been added to the “Understanding to China” collection by the “Editions in Foreign Languages” Public publisher. In the same note, it is also said that these books "stated as remarkable achievements in the field of cultural exchanges between China and Portuguese-speaking countries, gathering important gaps in the field of the publication of Chinese classics in the Lusophone world." The “unique merits” of the award -winning, conquered “in the translation of old classic works”, and the organizers of the prize do not forget the fact that Giorgio Sinedino have come to “seek new directions, expanded their specialties to also include the modern literature of China”. Lu Xun's work The connecting office also highlights Giorgio Sinedino's new work published this month in Brazil, dedicated to Lu Xun's poetry, which is entitled “Scream de Lu Xun - dramatized translation and critical studies by Giorgio Sinedino” and has the seal of Publishing 34. The work resulted from “four years of research and experimentation”, and was supported by the China Ministry of Education, the Lu Xun Museum of Beijing, the Lu Xun Research Foundation and the World Culture, as well as the Feng Zikai Foundation. It is noteworthy that “the final text was calibrated to correspond to the profile of Portuguese-speaking readers”, and in the translation process Giorgio Sinedino “followed certain standards of the literature of this language and combined the reading habits and stylistic preferences of his audience, producing a faithful recreation of Lu Xun's classic”. This "dramatization" required the use, by the award -winning author, of "a new method of literary translation, in which the usual conventions of translation be broken." Thus, there was the “reinforcement of the original text depending on the impact of dramatic situations and the tension of characterizations”, attributing “a new vitality to the already canonized stories of that great Chinese writer”. In this context, “Sinedino expressed his confidence that his new work will provide a new reading experience for the Lusophone aficionados of Chinese literature,” he said. Giorgio Sinedino has also been highlighted in the editions in Macao, having launched, in 2022, at the Rui Cunha Foundation, the book “Confucius-The Founder of Tradition”, an initiative of the Center for Chinese-Portuguese Bilingual Teaching and Training of the University of Macao (UM).

item.title: Water | Miriam Grupo carboys with high levels of bacteria
item.description:
It is the third case, since the beginning of the year, of waters distributed in Macau without complying with quality standards. The carboys were provided to public services, such as health services. In reaction to the case, Miriam Group accuses “some customers” of purposely contaminating the carboys used
The Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) has announced that several water carboys supplied to public services of the brand Sun spoiled in quality tests, presenting high levels of coliform bacteria and pseudomonas aeruginosa bacteria. Coliform are a type of bacteria, such as E.Coli, which inhabit the gut of mammals, while pseudomonas aeruginosa bacteria can be found in waters and soils and can lead to severe infections in the lungs, skin or urinary tract. The problem with water Sun, from Miriam Grupo Limited, was identified in lots produced on May 7 and 21 this year, and communicated on Friday. However, the information provided by AMI and SS did not reveal the time when the problems were detected by the entities. Since the beginning of the year, this has been the third brand of Macao Águas de Macau to have quality and safety problems. The first case took place on 9 March with the Iceblue brand, from the Oi Kou Pou factory. More recently, also in May, authorities have detected problems with water from the Ieong IAT Tat brand. Water Sun will have been provided to local public services, including health services (SS). However, it was denied that the contaminated water had entered the retail, hospitals or schools. "The two lots of distilled water did not enter the retail market, being mainly supplied to government services and commercial societies. The lots were not supplied to schools or hospitals," was reported by SS. After disclosure of the information, the SS announced the cancellation of the water supply of that brand: “After verification, the lots concerned were not provided to health services. However, for safety reasons, health services stopped using the potable waters of that brand, and began to use the bottled waters of another qualified brand, in order to ensure the supply of drinking water”, was justified. The statement does not identify if there is a new water supplier or if the watermark of Miriam Grupo Limitada has been changed. Attack of “some customers” Upon detection of this case, AMI reported that it requested the group to “apply prevention measures, namely the collection of the distilled water lots, as well as implementing the cleaning and disinfection of the production line”. Miriam Grupo Limitada also responded to the case by indicating that since June 1, which had issued a warning to warn of the collection of contaminated lots and that since May 30 the water production has been suspended for cleaning and applying the necessary rectifications. The same information indicated that compared to the plot of 7 May were collected 196 of the 367 carboys of water produced and compared to the lot of 21 May were collected 121 of the 432 carboys of distributed water. "Under the witness and organization of the AMI, the plots of abnormal water carboys were eliminated. Between May 30 and June 1, an independent cleaning company also cleaned the factory and production equipment. About 9,000 water carboys in May were eliminated," was released by the group. In the statement, the group also complained of media coverage, and denied that the plot of May 7 had presented positive results of coliform bacteria contamination, not denied contamination with pseudomonas aeruginosa bacteria. Miriam Grupo Limitada also accused some customers of contaminating the used carboys, which are later returned, to harm the company.

item.title: Economy | Inflation slowed to 0.19% in May
item.description: Inflation in Macao slowed in May, was announced on Friday, but the region escaped the fall in consumer prices, something that took place for the fourth consecutive month in the interior of China. The Consumer Price Index (IPC) in Macau rose 0.19 percent in May, in homologous terms, slower than the amount recorded in April (0.23 percent), according to official data released by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). Although the CPI has dropped 0.05 percent compared to April, the territory escaped for the third consecutive month of deflation (annual fall in consumer prices). Deflation reflects weakness in domestic consumption and investment and is particularly severe, as a drop in the price of assets, as awarded to credit, generates an imbalance between the value of loans and bank guarantees. China, by far Macao's largest commercial partner, has been in consecutive months in deflation after the IPC has retreated 0.1 percent in May, the same amount recorded in April and March. According to Macao DSEC data, the deceleration of inflation in May is due to the cost of meals acquired away from home, which rose only 1.39 percent, while the expenditures on apartment mortgages increased only 0.42 percent. The housing price index fell 11.7 percent last year, notwithstanding Macau's monetary authority approved three interest rates in the last three months of 2024. Despite the increase in the number of visitors, the region registered a 2.5 percent drop in the price of clothing and footwear.

item.title: Visitors | Second best start up to May
item.description:
Between January and May, 16.3 million visitors were received, the second best record of visitors. However, the number is still below what happened before the pandemic and the policy of isolation
Macau received 16.3 million visitors in the first five months of this year, the second highest amount ever for a year start, was announced on Friday. According to official data, the number of tourists who passed by Macau was only surpassed between January and May 2019 -before the COVID -19 pandemic -during a period when nearly 17.2 million visitors. However, according to the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC), almost 59 percent of visitors arrived on organized excursions and spent less than one day in the city. In 2024, the central government released a series of measures to support Macau, such as increasing the tax exemption limit of goods for personal use acquired by visitors from China. At the same time, Chinese authorities widened 10 other cities in China the list of places with “individual visas” to visit Hong Kong and Macau. Also, since January 1 that residents of the neighboring city of Zhuhai can visit Macau once a week and stay up to seven days. As a result, the overwhelming majority (90.7 percent) of tourists who arrived in Macao in the first two months of the year came from interior or Hong Kong, while only 1.14 million were international visitors. On January 17, Macao's director of tourism services, Maria Helena de Senna Fernandes, said he hoped Macau could receive between 38 and 39 million visitors this year. In August, the leader pointed to more than three million international visitors in 2025. More without visas The territory authorities announced on Monday that Saudi Arabia national citizens, Qatar, Kuwait, Barram and Oman are dismissed from a visa to enter Macao from July 16. The measure comes at a time when the Macao government wants to attract more international visitors and after the territory's authorities and tour operators visited in February Saudi Arabia and Dubai to promote cooperation. Despite the increase in the number of tourists, the average consumption of each visitor, excluding in the casinos, fell 13.2 percent in the first quarter of the year, compared to the same period of 2024. In early May, the direction of statistics and census services in the region pointed to the “change of visitors' consumption pattern” as one of the main reasons for the fall of 1.3 percent of Macau's economy between January and March. It was the first time that the territory's gross domestic product has shrunk in homologous terms since the end of 2022, when the region began to raise restrictions due to Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Industrial and financial weakness is obstacle to the Mozambican presence in Macau
item.description: Experts consider that Mozambican bet in Macau is kept conditioned by the lack of industry and financial resources, and that new partnerships, including the new Chinese regional project, can project Mozambique in the territory. By visiting the Macao Forum Product Exhibition Center last year, the Academic Fatima Papolo, which studies Sino-Mozambican relations, has realized the existence of few Mozambique products on site, where articles from various Portuguese-speaking countries are exposed. "There are many more Brazilian products, but it is, to some extent, a reflection of the Mozambican economic structure. I believe that, through the Macao Forum, we can also think about how to transform this economic structure positively and that will result in the existence of more Mozambican products to be sold in Macao," he said now to Lusa. Official data from the Macau government support the perception of the Joaquim Chissano University Academic in Maputo: the territory imported from Mozambique last year of goods worth about 12 million patacas. In the case of Brazil, the value exceeded a billion million patacas. In this sense, paper refers to the need to create “more events” that put agents of the Macao and Mozambique trade “to discuss and explore possibilities for deepening these relationships”. "It is also necessary to put other individuals linked to industry, because only a developed industry can check out products that will be changed. Mozambique still needs to work hard on this development of the industry and this is how it will turn their products into manufactured, put them in the Macao market and, perhaps, from all over China," he says. Forum is “differential” Created in 2003, the Macao Forum constitutes "a differential" in the relationship between Mozambique and China, says papers, but "there has been a long time that has not yet been done." "It is important to look like a space of exchanges. In this case, investments should come to Mozambique, but Mozambican investments should also go to Macau. This second sense needs to be worked," he says. Although China was one of the first countries to recognize Mozambique as a sovereign state, on the day it declared independence on June 25, 1975, the “fortification of ties” with Macau, then under Portuguese administration, will only take place after 1999. "From the moment the Chinese government begins to take control over the territory, then there is already this possibility that Mozambique also cooperates with Macau. So, this relationship begins to become much more alive, much more present," he says. Historian Wu Zhiliang considers the creation of the Macao Forum “a recognition” of the role of the territory as a bridge between China and Lusophone partners. Assuming that the region “has a lot to do to fulfill this mission well”, also president of the Macau Foundation refers to Lusa that the Forum should “expand its action, as well as the promotion of economic and commercial exchange, to the areas of teaching, culture and scientific research”. Bet on the bay An opportunity for Mozambique in the region constitutes, according to Fatima Papalo, the Great Bay, a project that Maputo should “enjoy and explore”. “I see a space in which Mozambique can promote their potential, can also seek services that will allow their economic development in various areas, from energy, industry, transportation, communication, because there is a lot of technological development in the area of ​​transport, to public policy formulation,” he proposes. And the Portuguese language, he says, will be “always advantage”: “It is necessary that Mozambique realizes this special place that has and makes good use of it, in the positive sense”.

item.title: Zelensky vs Zelensky
item.description:
10/27/22 A renovated Ukrainian, with the same name of the president, guilty Zelensky about the extension of the conflict that destroyed his village. Zelensky, the village, who has never left his land, now lives mortified because his favorite gravedigger died in the bomber. This Zelensky, the village, represents half the world that reproves the other Zelensky, the villain, for not wanting to negotiate with Putin. Negotiate what? The invader enters us through the house, pies us the wife and daughter (cf. recent UN report on Ukraine violations in this “special operation”), an act that forced us to watch, and then we say: Alto there, we are for peace, but we have to negotiate: You have not said the name you want to give to children! A peace that is not worthy is but a cessation of rights. As severe as Russophobia that Putin inflicts his people.
10/28/22 In a lunch with several guests I hear a friend, who declares himself a spiritist, explaining about the particularities of his belief, in a serene and balanced way, would even say, without "irrationalism". He discussed long and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytizing. “Here is someone to whom belief brought weighting!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at one point a phrase that horrify me. He says, “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!” And I enter the voracious fauces of holism. Because holismo has a pathological aspect like all good things, a side of shadow. Two examples: In Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is only an expression of the strict karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts she committed in her previous life. In Africa it is not accepted that death may have been accidental, and many women are accused by the dead family of having caused her husband's death, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, in a huge injustice to his wife - madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad for us, in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Now, I see, the indetermination, chance, the random of the terrible temptation of the causal cage. Holism, in its pathological feature, can be the reductionism that is the way it puts the way as a new 'eschatological narrative'. Is it "by chance" that the holism emerges at the moment when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person besides all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed with scholastic rigor stifles reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim suicide himself and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ who had not entered the story." Real always runs outside the track, in full exteriority to our concepts. This is what is worth a J. Pinto Fernandes at the exact moment we thought we had everything under control.

item.title: Nobel and others
item.description: 9/10/22 Reading many people's reactions when the Nobel Prize in this year's literature was announced, I couldn't help but remind me of this repair of Jean-Pierre Siméon, in relation to another Nobel Prize: “An editor of a large national newspaper wrote five lines of indignation because the Nobel Prize for Literature, a complete stranger. But unknown to whom? How did not occur to this patented and paid literary columnist to do his work, that his apparent ignorance was a matter of incorrect professional conduct? Tranströmer was translated into many languages, it was available in French. » There is always the choir of those waiting for the announcement of the prize to complain about not being invited to the jury of it, there is a subgroup of Irados that professes “I never read and I will not bother to read”; It is an uncommon fauna, which inhabits social networks. I don't always know all the winners-I was unaware of the existence of Louise Glück, who I find a great poet, or the Olga Tokarczuk, for example-but it only brings me the comfort of knowing that the world is not a soap opera where everyone knows each other and the joy of recognizing that the gauge of the world is not measured with my short measure and that on the contrary it gives me a new opportunity to face the unknown. And perhaps the most cretin of reactions was the smart one who wrote, but there are still those who read French? Confirming only that today there is a new kind of ignorance that fires with a displeasure: the one who only read English. I would also prefer that, in French, Pascal Quignard, Linda reads, or even Sollers, or, among the new ones, Mathias is awarded, but that does not take dignity to the work of Annie Ernaux (and it would be enough to have written the “Les Années”). There are books of her that I like less, like the vulgar "a simple passion," but this happens with almost every authors, they have a channel books and others that are like intervals in their itinerary. I advise reading a beautiful book of interviews with her, "L'Ecriture Comme un couteau". 11/10/22 Yesterday came an article in Maputo's morning “News”, realizing that the Pen Club narrative prize was assigned to my wife, Teresa Noronha, for her soap opera “Tornado”, which had already had the Maria Velho da Costa award. The summary they made of the book does not even deserve comments, by pathetic, but what matters to highlight is the note of disqualification about their "Mozambicanity" by calling it Luso-Mozambican. It is not inaccurate, but for those who know the context, it is a dirty touch. Because finally, following the same logic, Adelino Timóteo should be called Tsonga-Mozambican, to Álvaro Taruma-Mozambican, and Macua-Mozambican to the writers who are from the north, etc., etc. Which is not reported to happen. At the beyond moment, in the soap opera, she writes: «Our color has never been dominant. In colonial time we were not white, we were ripped from monories, gone mugs, the pejorative term to speak of a son of Goes and Portuguese. In the postcolonial period, I was not black and if, in Lisbon, they took me by Brazilian or Cape Verdean, already in France were lost in cogitations of where they would be and amazed when they found out it was African. item.title: MNE Iranian says that first Israelites and now USA "have exploded diplomacy"
item.description: The Iranian Minister of Foreign Affairs reacted to the European Union and London appeals to return to the dialogue by stating that the United States and Israel "decided to explode" diplomacy by bombing Iran. "We were negotiating (about the Iranian nuclear program) with the United States when Israel decided to explode this diplomacy," said Abbas Araghi, through platform X and then in statements in Istanbul, adding that when they were in dialogue with European Union countries -referring to Geneva negotiations this week -"the United States decided to reverse this diplomat." “What conclusions can you draw from this?” Araqchi replied to the appeals made yesterday by the head of European diplomacy, Kaja Kallas, and British Prime Minister Keir Stmerer. The EU high representative for Foreign Affairs, Kaja Kallas, called for “all parts” to take a “backwards”, return to the negotiating table and avoid a new climb ”after bombing, last morning, from the US against the major nuclear facilities of Iran. The British Prime Minister, in turn, called for the will "return to the negotiation table", stressing that "stability in the region is a priority." In the answer lasts to these appeals to return to the negotiating table, the head of Iranian diplomacy also maintained: "How could they go back to something he never abandoned, let alone destroyed?" To attack US President Donald Trump confirmed at dawn that the United States Armed Forces attacked three nuclear centers in Iran, including Ford, joining Israel directly to wage the country's nuclear program. "We have completed our successful attack on the three nuclear facilities in Iran, including Fordo, Natanz and Esfahan," Trump said in a social media post. The war began at dawn on June 13, with Israel to launch a vast military offensive against the Persian country, allegedly to prevent the advance of the Iranian nuclear program for military purposes. The attacks decimated Iran's military and nuclear infrastructures, which has responded with missile vacancies on major Israeli cities, including Tel Aviv and Jerusalem, as well as several military facilities throughout the country.

item.title: Rainfall | Floods leave tens of thousands of displaced
item.description: The intense rains that have plagued various southern and downtown China regions since the beginning of last week have affected at least 300,000 people and forced tens of thousands of residents, especially in Guangdong province. In the village of Huaiji, one of the most affected areas, the rains caused flooding of up to three meters deep, leaving half of the local roads. Images released on state television show muddy and neighbors and volunteers streets working in their cleaning. The situation is also critical in other provinces of the center and eastern of the country, such as Hunan, where the Lishui River has registered its largest flood since 1998. In the village of Longshan, four people remain missing after being trapped in a flooded underground garage. In the neighboring province of Hubei, the authorities have removed hundreds of people in municipalities such as Hefeng and Laifeng. In the latter, a day care center was completely flooded and it was necessary to transport 500 children in rafts, said The Paper newspaper. The Ministry of Water Resources sent technical teams to high -risk zones and asked local governments to reinforce surveillance and preventive evacuation of vulnerable areas. Local experts have warned in recent years that climate change may increase the frequency of extreme weather phenomena in the Asian country.

item.title: Visit | China and New Zealand bet on cooperation
item.description:
Despite the recent difference around the Cook Islands, the two countries reaffirm their commitment to deepen the historical bilateral relations
Chinese President Xi Jinping and New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon highlighted the solidity of bilateral relations Friday and bet on deepening cooperation, despite the differences in the approach between Beijing and the Cook Islands. During the meeting, held at the Great Palace of the People, next to Tiananmen Square, XI pointed out that China and New Zealand "have been going hand in hand" a half -century, in a relationship that "was at the forefront" of Beijing's bonds with developed countries. The Chinese leader said that both parties should “deepen economic and commercial cooperation”, explore new spaces in areas such as technological innovation and the fight against climate change, and “adequately manage differences”, preserving the principle of “mutual respect” and “pursuit of consensus”. Xi also noted that the two nations "have no historical conflicts or fundamental interests in dispute", which, he added, "must facilitate a constructive and stable relationship." According to CCTV state television, Luxon reiterated that his country "maintains a commitment to the policy of" one China "and expressed its intention to" reinforce high level dialogue ", while defending the expansion of cooperation in sectors such as agriculture, dairy and tourism. "The world is going through a period of uncertainty, and China is expected to play a relevant role," said the New Zealand Prime Minister, who was willing to collaborate with Beijing in the defense of the Multilateral Trade System and the preparation of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation Forum (APEC) that China will welcome by 2026. Views The visit occurs in a context of diplomatic tensions between New Zealand and the Cook Islands, after signing an agreement between the South Pacific and China, which led Wellington to freeze part of his help to development. Beijing rejected Wellington's criticism and stressed that his cooperation with the Cook Islands "is not directed against third parties, nor should it be interfered or restricted by third parties." China has argued that its agreements with the archipelago are based on “equality and mutual respect” and aim to “boost economic development and improve living conditions” in these territories of the Pacific.

item.title: Russia | Putin says Nato rearmament is not a threat
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said yesterday that NATO rearmament does not represent a threat to the country, ensuring that Moscow has the “defense capabilities” necessary to face the transatlantic alliance. "We do not consider any rearmament of the NATO as a threat to the Russian Federation, because we are self-sufficient in security," Putin said during a round table with representatives of international news agencies, on the sidelines of the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum. The Russian head of state added that the country is "constantly improving its armed forces and defense capabilities." At a time when the NATO prepares a new summit next week in The Hague (Netherlands), and encourages members to increase their investment in defense, Putin considered that an eventual budget reinforcement up to 5 percent of GDP would represent “specific challenges” to Moscow, but said that this financial effort “makes no sense” to the alliance countries themselves. "We will respond to all the threats that arise. There is no doubt," he said. Putin referred to the offensive launched against Ukraine in 2022 as part of a broader confrontation with NATO, which he considers to represent a “existential” threat to the Russian borders. In the board of future peace negotiations, the Russian leader expressed interest in discussing European security architecture, namely US President Donald Trump. Kiev, however, seeks safety guarantees from NATO as a condition for a possible agreement to end the war. Two cycles of negotiations between Russians and Ukrainians took place in Istanbul, but did not result in concrete advances. Putin also stated that Russian forces continue to advance “every day” in front of combat, facing a Ukrainian army in numerical inferiority and operational difficulties. On the ground, the Russian forces maintain daily attacks on Ukrainian cities and villages.

item.title: Japan | Earthquake with a magnitude of 6.1 sacode island of Hokkaido
item.description: A 6.1 magnitude earthquake yesterday reached the eastern coast of the Japanese island of Hokkaido in the north of the archipelago, without a tsunami alert or damage has been recorded. The earthquake occurred at 8:08 places with epicenter at an depth unspecified in the waters off the coast of the Nemuro Peninsula, according to the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA). The earthquake in the city of Kushiro reached level 4 on the 7 -level Japanese seismic scale, which focuses on the measurement of surface shaking and the destructive potential of the earthquake, and was felt less intense in other zones of Hokkaido and parts of Honshu's main island in the northeast of the country. JMA warned that the earthquake could cause some tide changes in the area, but added that there is no reason to worry about potential damage. Local authorities have not been informed of any earthquake -related incidents. Japan is located in the so-called fire ring, one of the world's most active seismic zones, and suffers land with relative frequency, so its infrastructures are specially designed to resist tremors.

item.title: More than 200 victims of the fall of Boeing 787 in India identified
item.description: Indian authorities announced Wednesday that they identified the bodies of more than 200 victims of flight 171 from Air India, which fired on June 12 in Ahmedabad, northwestern India. According to the clinical director of the city's Civil Hospital, Rakesh Joshi, until Wednesday, 208 victims of the accident were identified. The fall of the Boeing 787, shortly after being peeled to Gatwick airport in London, killed at least 279 people, according to the last official balance, making it the worst air disaster in the world since 2014. The plane, with 242 people on board, drew himself in an Ahmedabad residential zone on June 12, a minute after take-off at 13:39. According to the Indian civil aviation authority, this long -haul plane carried 230 passengers - 169 Indians, 53 British, seven Portuguese and one Canadian - and 12 crew members. Only one passenger, sitting next to an emergency exit on the front of the plane, miraculously survived the accident. On land, at least 38 people died, according to the latest balance. In investigation Civil aviation investigators in charge of the inquiry recovered the two black boxes of the plane, which record conversations on the cockpit and the technical parameters of the flight. According to the first conclusions, the pilot issued an emergency appeal (Mayday) shortly after taking off. Widespread video images after the catastrophe show the plane without being able to gain altitude and then pour heavily on the ground in an orange fireball. The Indian Civil Aviation Authority ordered an inspection of the other 33 Boeing 787 at the service in the Air India fleet “by precaution”. These inspections did not show "any major problem," the civil aviation authority said on Tuesday night. "The devices and maintenance systems were considered in accordance with the safety standards in force," he said. Air India announced Wednesday in a statement that will perform “Reinforced Safety Controls in the Boeing 787 fleet” and cancel some flights. "Geopolitical tensions in the Middle East, the mandatory gathering night in the air spaces of many European and East Asian countries, the ongoing reinforced safety inspections, as well as the necessary cautious approach adopted by the technical staff and the Air Pilots, led to the increase in the number of canceled flights," the airline said in the statement.

item.title: Israel | Chinese citizens begin to leave the country
